page.title: 02CATON,BROOKHOUSE+LITTLEDALE
page.content: There are 6 places of worship in the area-C.ofE.,Roman Catholic,Baptist, Congregational,Methodist and one in a farmhouse.A bowling green,cricket and football pitches are found adjacent to the Station Hotel.Sheepdog trials are held annually.Caton Gala was revived in 1984.A disused railway line is now a public walkway.The Victoria Institute is used by young and old for badminton, horticultural society and bingo.The old Congregational church is now a Youth Centre and YMCA,and is also used by the Leisure Club.There are 12 Parish Councillors and Clerk,and 2 District Councillors.The village newspaper The Link,published monthly, informs inhabitants about activities and contains a nature diary.
